title: Kraut Bierocks Recipe
description: These meat-mixture filled rolls make a great main dish, and are also great as a snack. They reheat well, so leftovers are also great! Sauerkraut can be used in place of the cabbage for more of a 'kraut flavor'.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Kraut Bierocks 4.6 (152) 124 Reviews 18 Photos These meat-and-cabbage-mixture filled sweet rolls make a great main dish, and are also great as a snack. They reheat well, so leftovers are also great! Sauerkraut can be used in place of the cabbage for more of a 'kraut flavor'. Submitted by Kim Van Pelt Updated on July 14, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 18 18 18 18 Prep Time: 45 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 45 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 10 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 ½ (.25 ounce) packages active dry yeast ½ cup white sugar 2 cups warm water 4 cups all-purpose flour ½ cup powdered milk 1 ½ teaspoons baking powder ½ cup shortening 1 pound lean ground beef 1 pound ground Italian sausage 1 cup chopped onion 3 cups shredded cabbage 3 tablespoons prepared mustard 2 teaspoons salt 2 teaspoons ground black pepper ½ cup shredded, processed American cheese ½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese Directions To Make Sweet Dough: In a medium bowl combine the yeast, sugar and water and mix together; let stand 10 minutes. Stir in flour, dry milk, baking powder and shortening, then knead mixture for 10 minutes, adding as little flour as necessary. Cover bowl with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place for 30 minutes, then knead again. To Make Filling: Meanwhile, brown beef, sausage and onion in a large skillet over medium high heat. Drain extra fat from skillet, then stir in cabbage, mustard, salt and pepper and cook for 5 minutes. Add cheese and cook, stirring, until cheese is melted. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Flatten a piece of dough. Place large spoonful of meat filling onto dough and fold over to form a round bun. Lay folded-side-down in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Repeat with remaining dough and filling. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until golden brown. I Made It Print 189 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 630 Calories 34g Fat 55g Carbs 25g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 630 % Daily Value * Total Fat 34g 44% Saturated Fat 13g 64% Cholesterol 69mg 23% Sodium 1129mg 49% Total Carbohydrate 55g 20% Dietary Fiber 2g 8% Total Sugars 14g Protein 25g 49% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 194mg 15% Iron 4mg 24% Potassium 443mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Kraut Bierocks 01 of 18 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 18 Photo by  rednecksamurai 12/16/2023 Can’t make these fast enough! 03 of 18 Photo by  Sherri Taylor 05/04/2020 I grew up with these called gropulas, my friend in Missouri calls them Runzas. I added more cabbage used green onions and an egg wash. They came out better than I remembered. 04 of 18 Photo by  Seth Calabrese 01/13/2020 05 of 18 Photo by  Pablo Martinez 06/06/2019 1 and 1/3 kg of flour. 1 cube of fresh yeast 2 cups of whole milk, no water. Double sugar and shortening Beat 1egg + 1 teaspoon of oil and paint them before oven. 16 large buns 06 of 18 Photo by  mswitch1971 05/25/2019 07 of 18 Photo by  mswitch1971 05/25/2019 08 of 18 Photo by  Kimberly Gomez 06/13/2018 It was very good and reminded me of my Moms! 09 of 18 Photo by  Shawn H 10/02/2016 10 of 18 Photo by  Mimi 08/31/2014 Although, what you see took 4 1/2 hours (made a double batch), they are yummy!! I don't think I'd make again, because they're a lot if work, and the end result are buns w hamburger. Sliders would have been much easier...but not authentic. 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Bierrocks I 28 Ratings Bierock Casserole 224 Ratings Runzas (Bierocks) 142 Ratings Meat Pie, Southern Version 40 Ratings French Canadian Tourtière 215 Ratings Cornish Finnish Michigan Pasties 171 Ratings Krautburger 77 Ratings Pork Pie 34 Ratings Black-Eyed Pea Pie 15 Ratings Poppyseed Stollen (Mohn Stollen) 6 Ratings Beef, Mushroom, and Guinness Pie 110 Ratings Steak and Potato Pie 18 Ratings German Zwiebelkuchen (Onion Pie) 66 Ratings German Pork Chops and Sauerkraut 239 Ratings Sausage 'n Kraut 13 Ratings Tourtiere (French Canadian Meat Pie) 177 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Kim Van Pelt
instructions: To Make Sweet Dough: In a medium bowl combine the yeast, sugar and water and mix together; let stand 10 minutes. Stir in flour, dry milk, baking powder and shortening, then knead mixture for 10 minutes, adding as little flour as necessary. Cover bowl with a damp cloth and let rise in a warm place for 30 minutes, then knead again.;To Make Filling: Meanwhile, brown beef, sausage and onion in a large skillet over medium high heat. Drain extra fat from skillet, then stir in cabbage, mustard, salt and pepper and cook for 5 minutes. Add cheese and cook, stirring, until cheese is melted.;Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Flatten a piece of dough. Place large spoonful of meat filling onto dough and fold over to form a round bun. Lay folded-side-down in a lightly greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.;Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until golden brown.
